SEARCH
Module hanyaeger
Package com.github.hanyaeger.api

Interface TimerContainer

All Superinterfaces:
TimerListProvider
All Known Implementing Classes:
SplashScene
public interface TimerContainer extends TimerListProvider
An TimerContainer enables a YaegerScene and YaegerEntity to use instances of Timer. When implementing this interface, the setupTimers() method needs to be implemented. The body of setupTimers() should be used to add instances of Timer, using the method addTimer(Timer). These timers will then be registered and added to the GWU.

A Timer that is instantiated, but not added in this way, will not work.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default void
    addTimer(Timer timer)
    Use this method to add any Timer that is required by the YaegerScene or YaegerEntity in which it is instantiated.
    default Updatable
    callTimers()
    Return an Updatable that, when called, call all the timers that were added to this TimerContainer.
    default void
    initTimers()
    Annotated with OnActivation, this method will be called during activation.
    void
    setupTimers()
    Only instances of Timer that are registered with the method addTimer(Timer) within this method are registered and will receive an animation update.

    Methods inherited from interface com.github.hanyaeger.core.TimerListProvider

    getTimers

  • Method Details

    • addTimer

      default void addTimer(Timer timer)
      Use this method to add any Timer that is required by the YaegerScene or YaegerEntity in which it is instantiated.
      Parameters:
      timer - the Timer that needs to be added

    • initTimers

      default void initTimers()
      Annotated with OnActivation, this method will be called during activation. First it will clear any timers from a previous activation, after which it will call setupTimers().

      Note: This method is part of the internal API, and should not be used when implementing a Yaeger game.

    • setupTimers

      void setupTimers()
      Only instances of Timer that are registered with the method addTimer(Timer) within this method are registered and will receive an animation update.

    • callTimers

      default Updatable callTimers()
      Return an Updatable that, when called, call all the timers that were added to this TimerContainer.

      Note: This method is part of the internal API, and should not be used when implementing a Yaeger game.

      Returns:
      an Updatable that delegates the Updatable.update(long) to all timers
